# Melodic Scale in C (Mode: Javanese, Shape: D)

The Melodic Scale in C, also known as Mode Javanese with the Shape D, is a unique and exotic scale that is used in various musical compositions to evoke a sense of mystery and intrigue. This particular scale has a distinctive sound that sets it apart from more traditional Western scales like the major or minor scales.

## Notes and Intervals
- The notes in the Melodic Scale in C (Mode Javanese, Shape D) are: C, D, Eâ™­, F#, G, A, B.
- The intervals in this scale are: whole tone, minor 3rd, augmented 4th, perfect 5th, whole tone, whole tone, whole tone.

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This scale is commonly used in world music, fusion, and experimental genres to add an exotic and mysterious flavor to the music. The Javanese mode brings an Eastern or mystical vibe to the compositions where it is utilized. The unique intervals and notes in this scale create a sense of tension and resolution that can be both haunting and beautiful.
